events.title: LOTERIA! (AKA Mexican Bingo!)
events.description: LOTERIA! Win fabulous prizes and join Hugo Award-winning artist John Picacio, as he hosts several rounds of this fun, easy-to-learn, fast-moving game of Mexican Bingo -- and presents his latest sf/f art visions of these classic icons.

events.title: Gannon Spills the Beans
events.description: Chuck Gannon's Question and Answer period on Terran Republic and the Ring of Fire!

events.title: Chris Kennedy Publishing - The Year Ahead
events.description: Join Chris Kennedy and his crew of writers as they discuss what the next year holds in store!

events.title: Career Retrospective: An Interview with Literary Guest of Honor Mike Resnick
events.description: Master of Ceremonies Charles E. Gannon interviews LGOH Mike Resnick, providing an retrospective of his illustrious career (nominated for 37 Hugo Awards, winner of 5!)

events.title: Open Filking
events.description: Nerd music free for all with Gray Rinehart

events.title: Nerd Music Free For All
events.description: Open Filking with Gray Rinehart

events.title: Board Game Klatsch with the Bielaczycs
events.description: The Bielaczyc Brothers will host a Board Game Klatsch in the Game Room - come and test your skill!

events.title: Dark Darker Darkest
events.description: Philip Paul Sacco (GameMaster): Dark Darker Darkest is an intense cooperative survival horror board game for a team of up to 7 players, urban survivors who try to fight the darkness in an unsettling location: the house of Doctor Mortimer, which holds the antidote to a virus turning the world into an army of undead.

events.title: Shadows Over Camelot
events.description: Philip Paul Sacco (Game Master): Shadows over Camelot is a cooperative/semi-cooperative hand-management and deduction-based board game for 3 to 7 players. Each player represents a knight of the Round Table and they must collaborate to overcome a number of quests, ranging from defeating the Black Knight to the search for the Holy Grail

events.title: Talisman Sudden Death
events.description: Philip Paul Sacco (Game Master): Talisman is an adventure board game set in a high fantasy medieval world. Players have 14 characters to choose from all based on role playing archetypes, such as heroes, wizards, villains, thieves, monsters, etc. The game makes players feel they are traveling the world to find equipment, weapons, ancient relics, and companions that will help them on their quest to acquire the Crown of Command.

events.title: Larry Correia's Gritty Cop Show
events.description: Larry Correia will run a demo of his RPG "Gritty Cop Show."  Slots for the players will be auctioned for charity - stay tuned for details!

events.title: Mad Scientist Roundtable
events.description: Roundtable discussion of various and timely science topics moderated by Les Johnson. This is a remarkable panel dating back to the earliest LibertyCons. Everyone gets a say but no one gets to say too much.

events.title: What's New in 1632 / Grantville Roundtable
events.description: Eric Flint moderates this panel on what is new in the 1632 / Grantville universe in all it's alternate history glory, with a mass autograph session to follow.

events.title: Black Tide Rising Roundtable
events.description: Come join John Ringo and his motley crew of authors for their roundtable on the Black Tide Rising anthology. Will be followed by a mass autograph session. Gary Poole, Mod.

events.title: TBI & PTSD from the Observers Point of View
events.description: Dr. Robert Hampson will moderate this roundtable discussion of doctors, trainers and family members discussing effects and stories of their loved ones, patients, co-workers, and team-mates who have suffered from TBI and/or PTSD. Traumatic Brain Injury and Post-Traumatic Stress affect more than just the military, athletes and accident victims who receive the injury; they also affect those people closest to the them.

events.title: Artificial Intelligence, Robotics and the Future of Work
events.description: Rich Weyand (Mod.) The Machine Intelligence Research Institute gives it even odds that all jobs will be done by robots in the not too distant future. PricewaterhouseCoopper has an estimate that 38% of all jobs currently done by people will be done by robots or AIs. So what does a society look like when few people are actually needed to do work?

events.title: All Things Monster Hunter Roundtable
events.description: Larry Correia moderates this Roundtable on the Monster Hunter Universe, to be followed by a mass autograph session.

events.title: No S**T There I Was Just Minding My Own Business ....
events.description: John Ringo moderates this "war story" discussion with writers who are veterans and law enforcement professionals.

events.title: Homo Stellaris: Becoming the People of the Stars
events.description: What will humans become as we begin to develop an interplanetary and interstellar society? Join Editors Les Johnson and Rob Hampson and their contributing authors to the upcoming fiction/nonfiction anthology "Homo Stellaris" for a discussion of potential changes to human society, psychology, biology and genetics in support of interstellar exploration and colonization.

events.title: The Sha'Daa: TOYS Roundtable
events.description: Q&A and Readings from Sha'Daa: TOYS by the authors, followed by a Mass autograph session.

events.title: Let's Predict the Next Big Thing!
events.description: In this roundtable, Science Pros prognosticate and will keep a record and see who got it right at LibertyCon 2019 for bragging rights! Jay Roye Moderator.

events.title: The Planetary Anthology Roundtable
events.description: Authors from the Superversive Press Planetary Anthologies will have a roundtable discussion on the series and it's future. Jagi Lamplighter Wright (mod.)

events.title: The Four Horsemen Roundtable
events.description: Chris Kennedy moderates The 4 Horseman Roundtable: Readings, Q&A, Discussion and Mass Autograph Session

events.title: Readings from the Carreraverse
events.description: Tom Kratman moderates this roundtable with readings from the new Carreraverse anthology.

events.title: NASA Update
events.description: Les Johnson on what has happened in the past year in Space, and what might happen in the coming years.

events.title: Baen Traveling Roadshow and Prize Patrol
events.description: Toni Weisskopf will be running the crowd through the best of what's going on in the Baen universe. (And there will be giveaways!)

events.title: Solar Updates and the Great American Eclipse
events.description: Scientist Stephanie Osborn presenter:  So, what's the Sun been doing lately? And what is a total eclipse really like from the centerline?

events.title: What's New from Steve Jackson Games
events.description: Steve Jackson dishes on the latest developments from his secret games laboratory. He will even sign autographs. Come one, come all!

events.title: Terraforming the Planets at Trappist-1
events.description: Ken Roy gives a fascinating presentation on what the future holds with respect to terraforming.

events.title: Reading:  Science GOH Dr. Kevin Grazier
events.description: Science GOH Dr. Kevin Grazier will read from his works.

events.title: The Art of John Picacio
events.description: Hugo Award-winning artist John Picacio has created bestselling book cover art for works by George R. R. Martin, Michael Moorcock, Dan Simmons, Sheri Tepper, Joe R. Lansdale, and many more. He'll answer questions from the audience and present a brand-new slideshow of his work and process. He'll reveal his latest covers and product artworks, and share a few super-secret sneak peeks into what he's currently working on.

events.title: ARTC Presentations: George Alec Effinger's "Terrific Park" and Robert A. Heinlein's "The Man Who Traveled in Elephants"
events.description: This year's Atlanta Radio Theatre Company (ARTC) presentations will be Terrific Park by George Alec Effinger (adapted for audio by Brad Strickland)  and The Man Who Traveled in Elephants by Robert A. Heinlein (adapted for audio by Brad Linaweaver). THERE IS ADVENTURE IN SOUND!

events.title: The Future History of Science and Technology
events.description: Future history has long been the realm of prophets, SF writers, and economists alike. Whether history repeats itself or merely rhymes, its ebb and flow may be described by Kondratiev Cycles, Anonymous Conservative's r/K selection theory, or Dr. Jim Penman's Biohistory. How do these historical cycles impact the development of science and technology? Dr. Schantz shows how scientific development oscillates between an Aristotelian phase in which new principles are identified and a Platonic phase in which the implications of those ideas are worked out. Arguing we now stand at peak Platonism, Dr. Schantz explains why he anticipates an imminent swing toward an Aristotelian phase and the profound opportunity this transition offers for lovers of liberty to shape not only culture and politics, but also to predict the future.

events.title: Organizing for War: Not Just for but Especially for Writers
events.description: Tom Kratman presents Organizing for War - What it takes and how to get it right when explaining it from the writers perspective. Tom will have an autograph session during the last 15 minutes.

events.title: Jupiter: Cosmic Jekyll and Hyde
events.description: Science GOH Dr. Kevin Grazier presents:  For about 15 years, on documentary television series, we've heard that Jupiter defends Earth from comets originating in the outer Solar System. New simulations, and even events from our historical past, show that Jupiter is just as likely to deflect comets AT Earth as away. What is the origin of the "Jupiter as Cosmic Shield" myth, and what do modern computer simulations tell us about Jupiter role in Solar System evolution?

events.title: The Food of the Star Trek Universe
events.description: Author and Foodie Denise Clemons presents a fascinating and enjoyable view of the Food of the Star Trek Universe.  Come and bring your appetite!

events.title: Holly"Weird" Science
events.description: Science GOH Dr. Kevin Grazier and science consultant to Hollywood presents how science and scientists are portrayed in the entertainment industry. Includes a discussion of the science of Battlestar Galactica.

events.title: Mad Scientists and Monsters: Darwins Effect on late 19th Century Gothic Horror Literature
events.description: Darwin is not so much the father of evolutionary theory as he is a Titan releasing a scientific Kraken on the Victorian world. A modern Prometheus changing how we view the world forever. New ways of thinking challenge old patterns and out of this ideological conflict is birthed a new mythology. Here is the origin of all our modern myths. Dragons become sauropods and werewolves become ape men. Magic is transformed into science and the world falls into a new age of epic adventure.

events.title: Blockchain: What is it and Why Does it Matter.
events.description: Rich Weyand will do a presentation on the technology behind blockchain, the security structure that enables cryptocurrency.

events.title: Baby Photos
events.description: Mike Resnick will present a slide show he has presented at WorldCon - a stroll down memory lane of hopeful young writers and the superstars they became! Come and enjoy the fun!

events.title: Kiss Your Ash Goodbye: The Yellowstone Supervolcano
events.description: The Yellowstone supervolcano is a known threat. What caused it, what happens when it erupts, and when will it erupt next? Stephanie Osborn presents.

events.title: Tales from the Grid
events.description: Jim Beall regales us with "Tales from the Grid" - Traces America's electrification, including inventions, feuds, rivalries, and revenge from Edison to today, and from P. T. Barnum's mighty elephant to California's threatening duck, with over 50 slides and videos.

events.title: The Worlds of David Weber
events.description: David Weber presents: My Worlds and Welcome to Them!

events.title: Hypnotism Presentation / Demonstration
events.description: Magician Philip Paul Sacco presents one of the lesser understood arts of magic, Hypnotism.  Begins with an introduction to what hypnotism is, and then asks for volunteers to become subjects.

events.description: For the kids who love to dress up and show off we offer a great combo. Doc Osborn will introduce each child at the start of his Magic Show and then entertain them in his wonderful world of magic while judges award prizes (Judges: Jonna Hayden, Tamara Lowery and Debi Chowdhury).

events.title: World Building Workshop for Screenplays vs. Novels
events.description: Screenwriter Robert Evans will run a 90 minute workshop highlighting what the differences are between building worlds in screenplays and in novels.

events.title: How to Become More Successful as an Indy Author
events.description: John Van Stry has over a dozen best sellers on Amazon as well as four number one best sellers. Working full-time as an author for several years now, and he has recently made it into the ranks of a six-figure author and is willing to share his experiences of what has worked for him with other authors who are struggling to trying and become more successful.

events.title: Chain Mail Workshop
events.description: Bryan Jones will conduct a workshop on the ancient skill of creating chain mail. He will provide rings and fittings gratis for each attendee to make a chain mail bracelet.

events.title: How to Approach Publishers Workshop
events.description: D. Alan Lewis conducts this workshop on how best to approach publishers with you proposals and manuscripts.

events.title: Overview of Scrivener for Writers
events.description: Dave Schroeder will run a workshop on Scrivener, the popular writing and database tool for authors.

events.title: Workshop:  Three Act Structure
events.description: Anna Grace Carpenter will present a workshop on "Three Act Structure: The Basics of Plotting and Outlining a Novel"

events.title: Writing Effective Amazon Ads for Indie Authors
events.description: Author Terry Maggert will do a presentation / workshop on how market your works effectively using Amazon.

events.title: Learn Glass Cutting from a Master
events.description: Master Stained Glass Artisan Leia Powell has been creating glass masterpieces for 20+ years. This 90-minute workshop will be hands-on how to cut and break glass to fit a pattern. Glass cutter and grozing pliers included in the $25.00 fee for this workshop. (10 person limit, so register fast!). First come first serve, send your payment (counts as your registration) via PayPal to fearandtrust@yahoo.com.  We will notify on the LC FB page when the class is full. Liability waiver required for the workshop.

events.title: Puppetry Workshop
events.description: Bryan Jones hosts this workshop on basic puppetry and puppet making.
